description.lang: An electric strike is an access control device used to lock and release doors. Electric strikes are installed in or on the doorframe and work in conjunction with mechanical door lock, on the principle of electronically controlling the rotation of the keeper allowing for door opening without manual retraction of the mechanical door lock. This product combines a 16 mm thick strike lock (that will fit into almost all door formats) with a Z-Wave plus empowered wireless control. The lock mechanics and the Z-Wave control are operated by a 9V block battery or an external 8-12V AC / 8-24V DC transformer. The Z-Wave control accepts commands to open or close the strike. Depending on a configuration parameter the door will be looked automatically after a certain time even if no close command was sent. The device can be used standalone and within every conventional Intercom system controlling strike locks.
This parameter defines the value of the BASIC Set command issued into association group 2 when the dry contact opens.
This parameter defines the value of the BASIC Set command issued into association group 2 when the dry contact closes.
Depends on Power in Inclusion Moment
